description: Daria Tomenko approves and implements the Council's Loyalty Lottery system update, prioritizing a façade of stability and fairness despite concerns about reinforcing inequity.

The Council announces the citywide Loyalty Lottery—neighborhoods excelling in mutual aid and volunteerism will receive privileged resource access, presented as a move toward fairness. Official messaging highlights Daria's technical oversight.
Community groups and free zones mobilize for the lottery, boosting local volunteer initiatives. BCI scores surge in active districts as competitive spirit spreads.

Oksana Lintz detects that winning zones consistently align with traditionally high BCI-scoring neighborhoods, regardless of current aid levels. She warns select colleagues of likely code manipulation favoring old power structures.

Lottery code leaks spark public outrage as manipulated outcomes are exposed. Protests escalate, with volunteers and free zone leaders accusing the Council of perpetuating BCI-era injustice under a new system. Deep societal division grows beneath a superficial calm.
